result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery Gordon Holm Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
with Huber for work and treatment release
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes:
If Probation is revoked and sent to jail or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
If revoked and sent to prison, DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmates monies to pay fines/costs with the balance due as a condition of extended supervision/parole.

Counseling/assessments/treatment deemed appropriate by agent including AODA and Domestic Abuse counseling.
Provide DNA sample.

No violent or abusive contact with victim 1.
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery Gordon Holm Jr

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Defendant Jeffery Gordon Holm Jr appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by phone for Jeffery Gordon Holm Jr.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court has received plea questionnaire and Victim Impact Statement.
Defendant waives right to an in-person hearing today. 
State - Count 1 - 18 months Probation with conditions as stated on the record, Defense free to argue.
Deft pleads Guilty - Court finds Guilty.
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
Victim by phone and makes a statement.
State makes sentencing argument.
Defense makes sentencing argument.
Deft makes statement to Court. Is on Probation in Winnebago County but unsure of discharge date.
Court orders 8 months Jail with Huber for work & treatment release, consecutive to any other sentence - imposed and stayed in favor of 18 months Probation with conditions as stated on the record.

Victim Impact Statement - signed 9/7/22
The original document was titled: Victim Impact Statement
The original history event date is: 09-07-2022
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No contact directly or indirectly with the residence/property listed in the bail bond.
No violent or abusive contact with the party/parties named in the bail bond as long as Deft is in custody or while Deft is in treatment and compliant with treatment program, if Deft becomes non-compliant then bond will revert back to no contact directly or indirectly with the party named in the bail bond.
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements.

3:59 PM Defendant Jeffery Gordon Holm Jr appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by phone for Jeffery Gordon Holm Jr.  Attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State's Motion to Modify Bond at request of victim - victim is requesting no contact order to be modified to no violent/abusive contact and victim has completed ERD Program through Safe Harbor.
Victim in courtroom and makes statement to Court - also requesting to drop the no contact order with her address that is listed on the bond.
State objects to any modification of bond. 
Atty Derksen argues for modification of bond. 
Court modifies bond conditions to no violent/abusive contact as long as Deft is in custody and compliant with treatment program, all other conditions to remain.
Deft makes statement to Court and requests cash bond be converted to signature bond.
Court will not amend cash at this time.

11:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffery Gordon Holm Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video for Jeffery Gordon Holm Jr. Defendant advised of rights. Received complaint/waived reading. NG Plea entered. 950 Marcy's law complied with. Probable cause found in the complaint. Bond set.
